item.title: Automatic differentiation of discontinuous integrals
item.description: This is a much simplified writeup of a problem I encountered, in a self-contained blog post. You want to approximate the integral [ I(\theta) = \int 1(g(x) > 0) f(x,\theta) dx ] where $g$ is a continuous function, and $f(x,\theta)$ is a parametric distribution over $x$. Everthing is continous, and thus $I$ is, too. You face the following constraints: $g$ is a black box. We will pretend that you can’t invert it (except for checking our results, of course).
